intro: Hamelia calycosa, commonly known as the flame beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture, while its stems are erect and branching. Hamelia calycosa is valued in gardens for its vibrant flowers and adaptability to various growing conditions.
